paper_abstract: In this paper, how to overcome the barrier for a finite difference method to obtain the numerical solutions of a one-dimensional Schrodinger equation defined on the infinite integration interval accurate than the computer precision is discussed. Five numerical examples of solutions with the error less than 10(-50) and 10(-30) for the bound and resonant state, respectively, obtained by the Obrechkoff one-step method implemented in the multi precision mode. which include the harmonic oscillator, the Poschl-Teller potential, the Morse potential and the Woods-Saxon potential, demonstrate that the finite difference method can yield the eigenvaltles of a complex potential with an arbitrarily desired precision within a reasonable efficiency. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Arbitrarily precise numerical solutions of the one-dimensional Schrodinger equation
